types.name: CmsParent
types.description:
A CMS parent is a web site managed by Intercode. It acts as a container for CMS content, such
as pages, partials, files, layouts, variables, content groups, and user-defined GraphQL queries.

Most CMS parents are conventions, so their content will be convention-specific and scoped to
that convention's domain name. The exception to this is the root site, which is what Intercode
renders when there is no convention associated with the current domain name. (See the RootSite
object for more details about this.)

fields.name: cmsContentGroup
fields.description:
Finds a CMS content group by ID within the domain name of this HTTP request. If there is no
CMS content group with that ID, or the CMS content group is associated with a different
domain name, errors out.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the CMS content group to find.

fields.name: cmsContentGroups
fields.description: Returns all CMS content groups within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsFiles
fields.description: Returns all CMS files within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsGraphqlQueries
fields.description: Returns all CMS GraphQL queries within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsLayouts
fields.description: Returns all CMS layouts within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsNavigationItems
fields.description: Returns all CMS navigation items within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsPage
fields.description:
Finds a CMS page within the domain name of this HTTP request. Exactly one of the three
optional arguments (`id`, `slug`, and `rootPage`) must be specified. These each represent a
different way of finding a page. If the desired page can't be found within the current
domain name, errors out.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the page to find.

args.name: slug
args.description: The unique slug of the page to find.

args.name: rootPage
args.description: If true, returns the root page for this domain.

fields.name: cmsPages
fields.description: Returns all CMS pages within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsPartials
fields.description: Returns all CMS partials within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsVariables
fields.description: Returns all CMS variables within the current domain.

fields.name: defaultLayout
fields.description: Returns the default CMS layout used in this domain.

fields.name: effectiveCmsLayout
fields.description:
Returns the CMS layout to be used for a particular URL path within the current domain. (This
will be the page-specific layout if the URL corresponds to a page with a layout override, or
the default layout for the domain otherwise.)

args.name: path
args.description: The path to find the effective layout for.

fields.name: fullTextSearch
fields.description: Does a full-text search within this domain.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this object.

fields.name: liquidAssigns
fields.description:
Returns all the Liquid assigns for regular CMS page rendering in the current domain name.
This is a combination of globally-accessible Liquid assigns and domain-specific user-defined
CMS variables.

fields.name: previewLiquid
fields.description: Given a Liquid text string, renders it to HTML and returns the result.

fields.name: previewMarkdown
fields.description: Given a Markdown text string, renders it to HTML and returns the result.

args.name: eventId
args.description: The event ID that this Markdown will apply to, if applicable.

args.name: eventProposalId
args.description: The event proposal ID that this Markdown will apply to, if applicable.

fields.name: rootPage
fields.description: The CMS page used for the root path (/) of this domain.

fields.name: typeaheadSearchCmsContent
fields.description:
Finds CMS content by partial name, case-insensitive, within the current domain's CMS content.
For example, in a convention that has a partial called `attendee_profile` and a page called
`info_for_attendees`, a search for `attendee` would return both of these.

This query is always limited to a maximum of 10 results.

args.name: name
args.description: The partial name to search by.  If not specified, returns all CMS content within the current domain (limited to 10 results).

types.name: Convention
types.description:
A Convention in Intercode is essentially a web site hosted by Intercode.  A Convention can represent an actual,
real-world convention (and this is probably the most common use case), but it can also represent a single event
(if the site_mode is set to single_event) or a series of events over time (if the site_mode is set to event_series).

They're called Convention for historical reasons, because naming is hard.  Sorry.  It's probably best to think of
them as "web site."

fields.name: clickwrap_agreement_html

fields.name: events
fields.description:
Returns all active events in convention associated with the domain name of this HTTP request.
Filterable by a range of start/finish times.

**CAUTION:** this query can return a lot of data and take a long time. Please be careful
when using it.

args.name: filters
args.description: If present, filters the returned events.

args.name: finish
args.description: If present, only returns events that occur earlier than this time (non-inclusive.) These events may end after this time, but start before it.

args.name: includeDropped
args.description: If true, includes dropped events in addition to active events.

args.name: start
args.description: If present, only returns events that occur at this time or later. (These events may have started before that time, but will still be ongoing during it.)

types.name: PaginationInterface
types.description:
PaginationInterface provides a way to use offset-based pagination on a list of objects. This
is useful for UIs such as Intercode's table views, which provide a way to jump between numbered
pages.

Page numbers in PaginationInterface are 1-based (so, the first page is page 1, then page 2,
etc.) The number of items per page can be controlled via the per_page argument on paginated
fields. It defaults to 20, and can go up to 200.

Offset-based pagination is different from
[Relay's cursor-based pagination](https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm) that is more
commonly used in GraphQL APIs. We chose to go with an offset-based approach due to our UI
needs, but if a cursor-based approach is desirable in the future, we may also implement Relay
connections alongside our existing pagination fields.

fields.name: oauthPreAuth
fields.description:
Given a set of valid OAuth query parameters for the `/oauth/authorize` endpoint, returns a
JSON object containing the necessary data for rendering the pre-authorization screen that
checks if you want to allow an application to access Intercode on your behalf.

This essentially emulates the JSON behavior of
[Doorkeeper](https://github.com/doorkeeper-gem/doorkeeper)'s API-only mode if you go to
`/oauth/authorize` with query parameters. The only reason this query exists, rather than
simply having clients actually call `/oauth/authorize`, is that we're running Doorkeeper
in regular mode so that we can get the server-rendered HTML admin views.

When we've implemented our own admin screens for OAuth
(see [this Github issue](https://github.com/neinteractiveliterature/intercode/issues/2740)),
this query will be deprecated.

represented as a JSON object.

fields.name: cmsContentGroup
fields.description:
Finds a CMS content group by ID within the domain name of this HTTP request. If there is no
CMS content group with that ID, or the CMS content group is associated with a different
domain name, errors out.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the CMS content group to find.

fields.name: cmsContentGroups
fields.description: Returns all CMS content groups within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsFiles
fields.description: Returns all CMS files within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsGraphqlQueries
fields.description: Returns all CMS GraphQL queries within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsLayouts
fields.description: Returns all CMS layouts within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsNavigationItems
fields.description: Returns all CMS navigation items within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsPage
fields.description:
Finds a CMS page within the domain name of this HTTP request. Exactly one of the three
optional arguments (`id`, `slug`, and `rootPage`) must be specified. These each represent a
different way of finding a page. If the desired page can't be found within the current
domain name, errors out.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the page to find.

args.name: slug
args.description: The unique slug of the page to find.

args.name: rootPage
args.description: If true, returns the root page for this domain.

fields.name: cmsPages
fields.description: Returns all CMS pages within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsPartials
fields.description: Returns all CMS partials within the current domain.

fields.name: cmsVariables
fields.description: Returns all CMS variables within the current domain.

fields.name: defaultLayout
fields.description: Returns the default CMS layout used in this domain.

fields.name: effectiveCmsLayout
fields.description:
Returns the CMS layout to be used for a particular URL path within the current domain. (This
will be the page-specific layout if the URL corresponds to a page with a layout override, or
the default layout for the domain otherwise.)

args.name: path
args.description: The path to find the effective layout for.

fields.name: fullTextSearch
fields.description: Does a full-text search within this domain.

fields.name: liquidAssigns
fields.description:
Returns all the Liquid assigns for regular CMS page rendering in the current domain name.
This is a combination of globally-accessible Liquid assigns and domain-specific user-defined
CMS variables.

fields.name: previewLiquid
fields.description: Given a Liquid text string, renders it to HTML and returns the result.

fields.name: previewMarkdown
fields.description: Given a Markdown text string, renders it to HTML and returns the result.

args.name: eventId
args.description: The event ID that this Markdown will apply to, if applicable.

args.name: eventProposalId
args.description: The event proposal ID that this Markdown will apply to, if applicable.

fields.name: rootPage
fields.description: The CMS page used for the root path (/) of this domain.

fields.name: typeaheadSearchCmsContent
fields.description:
Finds CMS content by partial name, case-insensitive, within the current domain's CMS content.
For example, in a convention that has a partial called `attendee_profile` and a page called
`info_for_attendees`, a search for `attendee` would return both of these.

This query is always limited to a maximum of 10 results.

args.name: name
args.description: The partial name to search by.  If not specified, returns all CMS content within the current domain (limited to 10 results).

types.name: Run
types.description:
A run of an event within a convention. Events can have multiple runs of the course of a convention (with some
exceptions, such as conventions that use single_event site mode).

fields.name: confirmed_limited_signup_count
fields.description: The number of confirmed signups in limited-signup buckets for this run

fields.name: confirmed_signup_count
fields.description: The number of confirmed signups (regardless of bucket) for this run

fields.name: current_ability_can_signup_summary_run
fields.description: Whether or not the current user is allowed to request a signup summary of this run

fields.name: ends_at
fields.description: The time at which this run finishes

fields.name: event
fields.description: The event this is a run of

fields.name: grouped_signup_counts
fields.description:
A GroupedSignupCounts object for this run, from which more detailed information about the number of signups can
be obtained (sliced in various ways).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this run

fields.name: my_signup_ranked_choices
fields.description: The current user's SignupRankedChoices for this Run

fields.name: my_signup_requests
fields.description: The current user's SignupRequests for this Run

fields.name: my_signups
fields.description: The current user's Signups for this Run

fields.name: not_counted_confirmed_signup_count
fields.description: The number of confirmed, but not counted signups for this run

fields.name: not_counted_signup_count
fields.description: The number of non-counted signups for this run (regardless of confirmation status)

fields.name: room_names
fields.description: The names of all the rooms this run takes place in

fields.name: rooms
fields.description: The rooms this run takes place in

fields.name: schedule_note
fields.description: An optional, admin-only note to put on this run.  This note is not visible to most users.

args.name: filters
args.description: Filters to restrict what items will appear in the result set.

args.name: page
args.description: The page number to return from the result set.  Page numbers start with 1.

args.name: per_page
args.description: The number of items to return per page.  Defaults to 20, can go up to 200.

args.name: sort
args.description:
A set of fields to use for ordering the result set. The second field is used as a
tiebreaker for the first, the third field is used as a tiebreaker for the first two,
and so on. If the sort argument is missing or empty, the order of items will be left
up to the database (and may be unpredictable).

fields.name: signups_paginated
fields.description: The signups for this run

args.name: filters
args.description: Only return objects matching these filters

args.name: page
args.description: The number of the page to return (the first page is 1)

args.name: per_page
args.description: The number of items to return per page

fields.name: starts_at
fields.description: The time at which this run starts

fields.name: title_suffix
fields.description:
If present, Intercode will append this suffix string to this run whenever it appears in the UI.  This can be
used to disambiguate between multiple runs of the same event.

fields.name: waitlisted_signup_count
fields.description: The number of signups currently on the waitlist for this run

fields.description: The number of the page currently being returned in this query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: The number of items per page currently being returned in this query

fields.name: total_entries
fields.description: The total number of items in the paginated list (across all pages)

fields.name: total_pages
fields.description: The total number of pages in the paginated list

types.name: SignupAutomationMode
types.description:
The automation behavior to use for event signups in a Convention.  Currently, we only support one type of
automated signups, the "ranked choice" behavior.  Conventions can also disable automation entirely using the
"none" value.

enumValues.name: none
enumValues.description: Signups are fully manual

enumValues.name: ranked_choice
enumValues.description: Attendees make a ranked list of choices and the site attempts to give everyone what they want

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: The number of the page currently being returned in this query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: The number of items per page currently being returned in this query

fields.name: total_entries
fields.description: The total number of items in the paginated list (across all pages)

fields.name: total_pages
fields.description: The total number of pages in the paginated list

enumValues.name: self_service
enumValues.description: Attendees can sign themselves up for events

enumValues.name: moderated
enumValues.description: Attendees can request signups and signup changes but con staff must approve them

types.name: SignupRankedChoice
types.description:
In a ranked-choice signup convention, SignupRankedChoices are the items in a user's signup queue.  Users may have
as many of these as they like.  When SignupRounds open, Intercode will automatically attempt to sign users up for
the number of events they're allowed at this time based on their SignupRankedChoices.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time this choice was added to the user's queue

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this SignupRankedChoice

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority of this choice (lower numbers are higher priority)

fields.name: requested_bucket_key
fields.description: The bucket that this choice is trying to sign up in (or null, if it's a no-preference signup)

fields.name: result_signup
fields.description: The resulting Signup from processing this choice, if it has been processed

fields.name: result_signup_request
fields.description:
The resulting SignupRequest from processing this choice, if it has been processed (and is in a moderated-signup
convention)

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current processing state of this choice (e.g. pending, accepted)

fields.name: target_run
fields.description: The event run that this choice is trying to sign up for

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The last time this choice was modified

fields.name: updated_by
fields.description: The user who last updated this choice

fields.name: user_con_profile
fields.description: The user whose queue this choice is part of

types.name: SignupRankedChoiceState
types.description: The processing state of a SignupRankedChoice

enumValues.name: pending
enumValues.description: We have not yet attempted to process this choice

enumValues.name: signed_up
enumValues.description: The attendee has been signed up (see the result_signup field for the actual signup)

enumValues.name: waitlisted
enumValues.description: The attendee has been waitlisted (see the result_signup field for the actual signup)

enumValues.name: requested
enumValues.description: The attendee has had a signup request put in (see the result_signup_request field for the actual signup request)

types.name: SignupRequest
types.description:
In a moderated-signup convention, SignupRequests are the queue of signups that users have asked to do.  Convention
staff can go through these requests and accept them (which produces a Signup) or reject them.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time this request was put in

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this SignupRequest

fields.name: replace_signup
fields.description:
The signup that this request is asking to replace (e.g. if the user is trying to leave a conflicting event).  If
this request is accepted, the replace_signup will be withdrawn.

fields.name: requested_bucket_key
fields.description: The bucket that this request is asking to sign up in (or null, if it's a no-preference signup)

fields.name: result_signup
fields.description: The resulting Signup from accepting this request, if it has been accepted

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current processing state of this request (e.g. pending, accepted, rejected)

fields.name: target_run
fields.description: The run the user would like to sign up for

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The last time this request was modified

fields.name: updated_by
fields.description: The last user who modified this request

fields.name: user_con_profile
fields.description: The user who made this request

types.name: SignupRequestState
types.description: The processing state of a SignupRequest

enumValues.name: pending
enumValues.description: The request has not yet been reviewed by a moderator

enumValues.name: accepted
enumValues.description: The request has been accepted and the requester has been signed up (see the result_signup field for the actual signup)

enumValues.name: rejected
enumValues.description: The request has been rejected and the requester has not been signed up

enumValues.name: withdrawn
enumValues.description: The requester withdrew their request before it was accepted or rejected

fields.name: current_page
fields.description: The number of the page currently being returned in this query

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: The number of items per page currently being returned in this query

enumValues.name: withdrawn
enumValues.description: Attendee has withdrawn from this event (and this signup is no longer valid)

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
